meanings.definition: The soft, white tissue found just under the bark of a tree.
meanings.sent1: The alburnums of the tree help transport nutrients.
meanings.sent2: The arborist studied the alburnums to understand the tree's health.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the alburnums as a secret hideout.
meanings.sent4: The alburnums, like a protective blanket, shielded the tree from harm.
meanings.sent5: The alburnums, delicate and pure, contrasted with the rough bark.

meanings.definition: A layer of cells in the skin that produces new cells.
meanings.sent1: The alburnums in the skin help in regeneration.
meanings.sent2: Dermatologists study the alburnums to understand skin health.
meanings.sent3: The alburnums in the skin seemed to work overtime, producing new cells non-stop.
meanings.sent4: Her skin, like the alburnums, constantly renewed itself.
meanings.sent5: The alburnums, like tiny workers, diligently create new skin cells.
